messages: a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:14): 7f0403df628d1e021d28f452d20f0290: the PHP parser doesn't perfectly match the current spec, but should work reasonably well on not-overly long documents (parts of PHP's DOM impl have O(n^2) perf, so it hurts)
7f0403df628d1e021d28f452d20f0290 (20:14): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: usage would be to parse articles to a DOM in a CMS so certain attributes/elements can be filtered on save
7f0403df628d1e021d28f452d20f0290 (20:14): so documents shouldn't be too long
7f0403df628d1e021d28f452d20f0290 (20:14): but I am slightly worried about it not perfectly matching the spec
7f0403df628d1e021d28f452d20f0290 (20:14): I wish the PHP devs would just get a proper parser into the core...
7f0403df628d1e021d28f452d20f0290 (20:14): thanks for your help tough

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:14): 7f0403df628d1e021d28f452d20f0290: Basically, when there were major changes to the spec a couple of years ago, I spent what seemed like an eternity making the tedious changes to the Python version, and never had the motivation to make them in PHP too. Especially seeming I ended up never using it in the end.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:14): (around script parsing, that was)
7f0403df628d1e021d28f452d20f0290 (20:15): btw, is there any open source c library available for html5 parsing?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:16): takkaria wrote one a few years back. No idea if it is maintained.
3a11d663baf9dd49fd3266d53d9bec5c (20:16): There will be a C++ one once hsivonen gets around to packaging his
3a11d663baf9dd49fd3266d53d9bec5c (20:16): Maybe even in this decade
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:17): foolip: previously, cues that were found to have been missed when the browser next checked for cues were just dropped on the floor
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:17): foolip: i fixed that
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:19): 3a11d663baf9dd49fd3266d53d9bec5c: You're hopeful. :)
3a11d663baf9dd49fd3266d53d9bec5c (20:20): One needs to be in this business... There's so little hope for the platform itself already ;)

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:40): 1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167, I'm not clear on who exactly has influence on the decision here, or who's going to make it, so I thought I'd reply to be on the safe side.  How exactly will a decision get made, and who has a say here?  Is there anyone in particular I have to convince or can ignore?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:41): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, which widget where you pick people to share with?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:41): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, and okay.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:42): when you do a post, the one where you pick the circles
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (20:42): I'm trying to not focus on who but what are the requirements and then see what we can propose to achieve these requirements.

1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (20:44): liam could have had a real proposal by saying we need to identify keywords, code, etc. I do not think the grammar of HTML whatever version is a guarantee, but the documentation of classname on HTML is a lot more for the purpose of the spec is what is needed. At the same time it was never really required in the past.
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (20:44): so it's why the argument is a bit MOOT
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (20:45): too much talk, not enough how-do-we-do-it
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:55): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, which part is contenteditable?  I don't see it.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:55): (too much div soup!)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:55): oh i don't know if it's actually implemented as contenteditable (though i can't see how else it could be sanely done)
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:55): I don't see any part that looks editable.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:56): i just mean the concept of a control that contains both editable text or immutable "chips"
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:56): let me get you a screenshot
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:56): Which part of the text is editable?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:56): It's an input, actually.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:57): They somehow cleverly make it not look like one.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:57): But the non-editable stuff is actually not part of the editable area at all, it's just sitting next to it.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:57): Still, this is what <span contenteditable=false> is for, yea.h
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:57): Although that's a huge PITA to spec/implement correctly, it adds corner cases to *everything*.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:58): crap gotta go. bbiab with screenshots.
